Description: Sherd from lid of North Ionian pottery pyxis; flanged underneath horizontal rim; light moulding at join of rim and lid on upper surface; underside reserved; upper side slipped cream; band of billets on outside of rim, two red lines on top; short tongues on moulding; on lid, from exterior: band with added red band lined in white; lotus and bud chain with added red; two lines; frieze of dots; band with added red band lined in white; uncertain object, perhaps horn of goat.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.580)
